message_1: In how many ways can 3 students be chosen out of a class of 25 to represent the class in a debate competition?
message_2:
To choose 3 students out of a class of 25, we can use the combination formula, which is:

C(n, k) = n! / (k!(n-k)!)

where n is the total number of students (25 in this case) and k is the number of students to be chosen (3 in this case).

C(25, 3) = 25! / (3!(25-3)!)

C(25, 3) = 25! / (3! * 22!)

C(25, 3) = (25 * 24 * 23 * 22!)/(3! * 22!)

C(25, 3) = (25 * 24 * 23)/(3 * 2 * 1)

C(25, 3) = (25 * 24 * 23)/(6)

C(25, 3) = 2300

So, there are 2300 ways to choose 3 students out of a class of 25 to represent the class in a debate competition.
